body_content.explanation: the state of having little water or other liquid :
examples: The amount you sweat can be affected by the dryness of the atmosphere.
The meat was juicy with no hint of dryness.

body_content.explanation: the fact or result of not having much rain:
examples: Southern Florida experienced unusual April dryness this year.
Healthy plants can better withstand stress from pests, heat and dryness.

body_content.explanation: (of a part of the body) the state of not having enough of the natural oils or liquid that make it soft, smooth, and healthy:
examples: Regular application of the lotion will help prevent dryness of the skin.

body_content.explanation: the fact of not being interesting :
examples: I myself enjoy the dryness of statistics.
The dryness of the speech had caused Joseph's attention to wander.

body_content.explanation: the fact of humour being funny in a way that is clever and not obvious:
examples: He is a politician who is noted for the dryness of his wit.
Once I understood the dryness of her humour, we had many laughs together.

body_content.explanation: the fact of wine or other alcoholic drinks not tasting sweet:
examples: The wine has just enough dryness to balance its fruitiness.
This chart shows the scale of sweetness (or dryness) of red and white wines.
